title: Worked Solution
text: Macroscopic. Copper wire is an object that can be seen with the naked eye and its density can be measured through physical means, such as weighing it and measuring its volume. The information provided about copper wire is related to its macroscopic properties, meaning properties that can be observed and measured on a visible scale, such as its density, mass, and volume. This information is not related to the microscopic properties of copper atoms or molecules, which are too small to be seen with the naked eye, or to the symbolic representations of chemical reactions, which involve chemical equations, formulas, and symbols.
